description: {"blocks":[{"key":"dtc2b","text":"This protocol is for recovering plasmid DNA from Bacterial Culture. To see the full abstract and other resources, visit https://www.addgene.org/protocols/purify-plasmid-dna/.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":120,"length":53}],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"E7AFE6450F354571BEA02E94BAE6830F","url":"https://www.addgene.org/protocols/purify-plasmid-dna"}}}}

fork_info.title: Recovering Plasmid DNA from Bacterial Culture

guidelines: {"blocks":[{"key":"b5iif","text":"Tips and FAQ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":12}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"d221e","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"3p403","text":"Plasmid purification kits provide the fastest way to obtain a high concentration of clean plasmid DNA. To improve the purity of plasmid DNA purified without a kit it is advisable to perform a phenol/chloroform extraction of the supernatant after step 6 and before step 7. This will help to remove proteins and other contaminants from the plasmid DNA.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"eh0cf","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"f7d2p","text":"It is also advisable to add RNAse to the supernatant after step 6 to eliminate RNA contamination. This is included in the resuspension buffer of most kits.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"2pkpf","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"a6jin","text":"Equipment","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":9}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"1avto","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"dsirj","text":"Desktop microcentrifuge","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"b20uu","text":"Desktop vortexer","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"dtsi9","text":"Vacuum (optional)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"cafrt","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"60tcs","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"2iblr","text":"Reagents","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":8}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"fvrvj","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"e8mv","text":"Overnight culture of bacteria transformed with your plasmid","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"e22ca","text":"Resuspension buffer","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"adg2i","text":"Denaturing solution","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"qvu0","text":"Renaturing solution","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"8g002","text":"2 mg/mL RNase A","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"4s69d","text":"TE or water-saturated phenol-chloroform","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"82k5i","text":"Chloroform","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"fn36q","text":"100% status.info: We use this protocol and it's working

steps.section: Generalized DNA Purification
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"aih7n","text":"Grow an overnight culture of bacteria.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":8,"length":30}],"data":[]},{"key":"6jei6","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"7057h","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"C3AD9B302C2811EA8F6F331FB21B990B","url":"https://www.addgene.org/protocols/inoculate-bacterial-culture/"}},"1":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":9,"offset":0,"style":"bold"}],"key":"dlmh1","text":"*Pro-Tip*","type":"unstyled"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"aqk0n","text":"Refer to appropriate DNA prep protocol for volume of bacteria to grow (low copy plasmids require larger cultures).","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{},"guid":"DF3F22247FD944659870DE509491E2BC"}}}}

steps.section: Generalized DNA Purification
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"f70eo","text":"Centrifuge the culture to pellet the bacteria before proceeding with DNA preparation.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"bua5c","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"ebkj9","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":9,"offset":0,"style":"bold"}],"key":"78ok7","text":"*Pro-Tip*","type":"unstyled"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"f365e","text":"If your entire overnight culture cannot fit into a single centrifuge tube, aliquot it into several tubes/bottles.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{},"guid":"A188598E4EAC464F998AF58D66FF0FD8"}}}}

steps.section: Generalized DNA Purification
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"15b44","text":"Remove the supernatant and resuspend the bacteria in buffer.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"fnoe2","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"9k5d9","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"aql8m","text":"Note, this step gets all of the bacteria back into suspension, but within a smaller volume of buffer that is compatible with the next solution.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{},"guid":"AA6229F245EC4916ACBD5224FCC5D283"}}}}

steps.section: Generalized DNA Purification
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"vb4","text":"Add a denaturing solution to the resuspended bacteria.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"60a4o","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"een3u","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"3kokd","text":"Note, this step causes the bacteria to lyse, releasing their contents, including plasmid DNA, into solution.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{},"guid":"E447DC05F8C74FF4A1DCBE8ACAB55EF7"}}}}

steps.section: Generalized DNA Purification
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"6lheu","text":"Add a renaturing solution to the denatured bacteria.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"3j8f0","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"7euti","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"8n96d","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"21p3g","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"7ql6l","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"13hch","text":"Note, this step brings the pH back down causing the proteins and genomic DNA to precipitate, while leaving the smaller plasmids free in solution.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{},"guid":"E1879B33AC7B49CAAACB3D90D35AE7AB"}}}}

steps.section: Generalized DNA Purification
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"dfb4q","text":"Pellet the proteins and genomic DNA by centrifugation, and remove the plasmid-containing supernatant.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Generalized DNA Purification
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"63fgs","text":"Add either ethanol or isopropanol to precipitate the plasmid DNA.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Generalized DNA Purification
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"96ig7","text":"Either spin to pellet the DNA or apply the solution to a column that will bind the now precipitated DNA.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Generalized DNA Purification
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"51omg","text":"Wash the pellet or column with 70% ethanol to remove excess salt.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Generalized DNA Purification
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"494ri","text":"Resuspend the DNA pellet, or elute the DNA off of the column using water or a neutral buffer such as TE. You will now have plasmid DNA that has been purified away from the bacterial proteins and genomic DNA. Depending on the method used, the DNA concentration and purity will vary. For more information on determining DNA concentration and purity click here.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":353,"length":4}],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"D247E5C0998811E9B13B7FDC9EF19A39","url":"https://www.addgene.org/protocols/dna-quantification/"}}}}

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"8tnmv","text":"Add   of Solution II and invert the tube carefully 5 times to mix the contents. The contents will become clear and thicker as the proteins and DNA are denatured.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":4,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"88sb7","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"8710b","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"200","guid":"F906E2D0CE7E11E9BC599D2B0B31E48A","id":0,"label":"","unit":1}},"1":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":9,"offset":0,"style":"bold"}],"key":"2hsbn","text":"*Pro-Tip*","type":"unstyled"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"4hvmf","text":"Do not vortex at this stage or the genomic DNA will become sheared and will therefore contaminate your purified plasmid DNA.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{},"guid":"966FA3747E6D47E48B043613D26AB275"}}}}
